d.title: Fixes for pagination in listview
d.body:
it has some small fixes which make pagination correct fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/2374
also fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/2687

* Check if metadata enrichment is needed
* If needed get the metadata from db and enrich the query
* Orderby logic updated for list view.

d.title: fix: UI/UX fixes on Global Actions (CMD / CTRL + K)
d.body:
## 📄 Summary

Linked Issues:

<!-- Describe the purpose of the PR in a few sentences. What does it fix/add/update? -->

---
## ✅ Changes
[] Feature: Added a fully customizable Cmd + K command palette. Users can quickly navigate to different parts of the application using keyboard shortcuts or by opening the palette from the left sidebar.

[] Bug Fix: Replaced the kbar library with a custom shadcn-based cmdK component published in our shared component library.
This resolves prior limitations such as:
1. inability to style elements (custom classes, icons, layout)
2. inability to add a search icon trigger from the sidebar
3. restricted customization of command items and sections
The new implementation provides full control over styling, icons, roles (RBAC), and interactions while maintaining cleaner integration across the app.


## 🧪 How to Test

1. Open the staging environment: https://app.us.staging.signoz.cloud/
2. Log in and press Command + K (Mac) or Ctrl + K (Windows/Linux). The command palette modal should open.
3. Open via sidebar:
Click the search icon in the left navigation panel (below the Home icon).
This should also open the command palette.
4.Logged-out behavior: When not logged in, the command palette should not render or open via any method.
5. Verify navigation shortcuts:
Inside the modal, clicking any command item should redirect the user to the corresponding page.

---

## 🔍 Related Issues

<!-- Reference any related issues (e.g. Fixes #123, Closes #456) -->
Closes # https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/9672
Closes - https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/9540

---

## 📸 Screenshots / Screen Recording (if applicable / mandatory for UI related changes)

Before: 



https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c28bbcfc-5c3e-4763-9d9f-f0e194e75cf2




After 


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/73935427-14e5-4668-969b-75826e5a9c65





---

## 📋 Checklist

- [x] Dev Review
- [x] Test cases added (Unit/ Integration / E2E)
- [x] Manually tested the changes


---

## 👀 Notes for Reviewers

<!-- Anything reviewers should keep in mind while reviewing -->

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a new @signozhq/command-based command palette with global provider and sidebar trigger, replacing kbar across the app.
> 
> - **UI**:
>   - **New `CmdKPalette`**: Implemented with `@signozhq/command`; supports Cmd/Ctrl+K, role-based actions, theme toggles, and sidebar pin/unpin; added styles and unit tests in `components/cmdKPalette`.
> - **App Integration**:
>   - Wraps app with `CmdKProvider` and renders palette when logged in in `AppRoutes`.
>   - Removes legacy `KBarCommandPalette` component and `KBarCommandPaletteProvider`; strips `kbar` usage from `AppLayout`.
> - **Navigation**:
>   - Adds "Search" primary item in `SideNav` that opens the command palette; hooks into click handling.
> - **Dependencies**:
>   - Adds `@signozhq/command`; removes `kbar` and related transitive deps; updates `auto-import-registry.d.ts` and `yarn.lock`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit deb49bd7b4fba7adf4696b9a6f1a23e2de1af816. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

d.title: feat: fixed panel correlation and alert multiaggregation issues
d.body: ## 📄 Summary Fixed - Panel correlation was not correctly spreading the filter expression - multi-aggregation was not honoured in create alerts, it always picks only the first aggregation - stepInterval not updating in panel qb - added test cases for - convertV5ResponseToLegacy, prepareQueryRangePayloadV5 and mapQueryDataFromApi --- ## ✅ Changes - [ ] Feature: Brief description - [ ] Bug fix: Brief description --- ## 🏷️ Required: Add Relevant Labels > ⚠️ **Manually add appropriate labels in the PR sidebar** Please select one or more labels (as applicable): ex: - `frontend` - `backend` - `devops` - `bug` - `enhancement` - `ui` - `test` --- ## 👥 Reviewers > Tag the relevant teams for review: - frontend / backend / devops --- ## 🧪 How to Test 1. ... 2. ... 3. ... --- ## 🔍 Related Issues https://github.com/SigNoz/engineering-pod/issues/2814 --- ## 📸 Screenshots / Screen Recording (if applicable / mandatory for UI related changes) --- ## 📋 Checklist - [ ] Dev Review - [ ] Test cases added (Unit/ Integration / E2E) - [ ] Manually tested the changes --- ## 👀 Notes for Reviewers ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Fixes panel correlation, alert multi-aggregation issues, updates stepInterval, and adds test cases for query payload functions. > > - **Behavior**: > - Fixes panel correlation by correctly spreading filter expressions. > - Ensures multi-aggregation is honored in alert creation, previously only the first aggregation was used. > - Updates `stepInterval` in panel query builder. > - **Tests**: > - Adds test cases for `convertV5ResponseToLegacy`, `prepareQueryRangePayloadV5`, and `mapQueryDataFromApi` in `convertV5Response.test.ts` and `prepareQueryRangePayloadV5.test.ts`. > - **Code Quality**: > - Removes unused properties `isColumn` and `isJSON` from various files to clean up code. > - Refactors `updateStepInterval` to `updateBarStepInterval` and adjusts its usage across the codebase. > - Simplifies `handleRunQuery` function by removing unnecessary parameters. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 60a09e0d95962318b357c5ae3e542e89a817176d. d.title: fix: stale threshold state after modifying alert conditions
d.body: ## 📄 Summary Due to recent changes where we shifted from supporting both YAML and JSON to only JSON unmarshalling, we deleted the parseIntoRule functions and overwrote the JSON unmarshalling functionality for PostableRule. With the new addition of Threshold and Evaluation features, we missed the case where, after a rule was updated, the system expected the new payload but continued receiving the older payload. As a result, the new structure for handling thresholds was not being populated in our rule processing default functions. Fix-> 1.) We added default versioning for older and newer payloads. For older payload default version would be v1, And if we want to use the newer payload we can use v2. 2.) For Patchable Rule we introduced the patchable struct with only disabled functionality for now. ## 🧪 How to Test 1. Test the edit rule functionality for alert configuration updates 2. Test the disable rule functionality --- ## 🔍 Related Issues Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/9123 Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/9122 Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/9137 --- ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Introduces rule versioning and patching functionality to handle older and newer payloads, with extensive testing for robustness. > > - **Behavior**: > - Introduces versioning for rule payloads in `api_params.go`, defaulting to `v1` for older payloads and `v2` for newer ones. > - Adds `PatchRule` functionality in `manager.go` to support attribute-level changes without full rule replacement. > - **Testing**: > - Adds `TestManager_PatchRule_PayloadVariations` in `manager_test.go` to validate patching behavior. > - Adds `TestParseIntoRuleSchemaVersioning` in `api_params_test.go` to test schema versioning logic. > - **Misc**: > - Updates `makeRulesManager` in `server.go` to use new rule store interfaces. > - Adds `MockSQLRuleStore` in `rulestoretest/rule.go` for testing SQL interactions. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for d8d640fc91350cc7e21fbb2e12761e429499c0bd. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/SigNoz/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: improve ttl integration tests
d.body:
## 📄 Summary

<!-- Describe the purpose of the PR in a few sentences. What does it fix/add/update? -->
This pull request introduces several improvements and additions to the integration test fixtures, focusing on better management and cleanup of TTL (Time-To-Live) and storage policy settings for ClickHouse tables used in logs, metrics, and traces tests. It also enhances the ClickHouse test container configuration and improves some test utility logic. The most important changes are grouped below:

**TTL and Storage Policy Cleanup Fixtures:**

* Added new fixtures to remove TTL and reset storage policy settings for metrics, traces, and logs tables, ensuring test isolation and preventing side effects from previous tests. These fixtures are defined in `fixtures.metrics`, `fixtures.traces`, and `fixtures.logs` respectively. (`tests/integration/fixtures/metrics.py`, `tests/integration/fixtures/traces.py`, `tests/integration/fixtures/logs.py`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-bb41a063c67ce1adec72f46009358410ca656a2348edb6312fe7f89775f079fbR1-R32) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8c7e254d35ad47c5a9860ec65bb3eff318125eb9b662853f096429cedbf0c29dR719-R747) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199L496-R565)
* Registered the new `fixtures.metrics` module in the test suite's conftest, so its fixtures are available across tests. (`tests/integration/conftest.py`)

**ClickHouse Table Setup and Data Insertion Improvements:**

* Updated ClickHouse table creation, renaming, and dropping commands to consistently use the `ON CLUSTER` clause, ensuring compatibility with multi-node clusters. (`tests/integration/fixtures/logs.py`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199L428-R462) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199L471-R505) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199L496-R565)
* Added explicit `column_names` to data insertion calls for logs and resource logs tables to improve clarity and reduce the risk of schema mismatch errors. (`tests/integration/fixtures/logs.py`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199R354-R358) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199R398-R418)
* Removed hardcoded values from the log array construction, making the test data more flexible and maintainable. (`tests/integration/fixtures/logs.py`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199L37-L38) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-482366b5152cc44064881cabe730d1873bc214e6a84bf6b6a17a4989ed451199L328-L329)

**ClickHouse Test Container Configuration:**

* Enhanced the ClickHouse test container configuration to define multiple storage disks and policies, supporting tiered storage scenarios in integration tests. (`tests/integration/fixtures/clickhouse.py`)

**Test Utility Logic:**

* Improved the readiness check for the SigNoz container to return only when the HTTP status is OK, making the test startup logic more robust. (`tests/integration/fixtures/signoz.py`)

---

## ✅ Changes

- [ ] Feature: Brief description
- [ ] Bug fix: Brief description

---

## 🏷️ Required: Add Relevant Labels

> ⚠️ **Manually add appropriate labels in the PR sidebar**  
Please select one or more labels (as applicable):

ex:

- `frontend`
- `backend`
- `devops`
- `bug`
- `enhancement`
- `ui`
- `test`

---

## 👥 Reviewers

> Tag the relevant teams for review:

- frontend / backend / devops

---

## 🧪 How to Test

<!-- Describe how reviewers can test this PR -->
1. ...
2. ...
3. ...

---

## 🔍 Related Issues

<!-- Reference any related issues (e.g. Fixes #123, Closes #456) -->
Closes #

---

## 📸 Screenshots / Screen Recording (if applicable / mandatory for UI related changes)

<!-- Add screenshots or GIFs to help visualize changes -->

---

## 📋 Checklist

- [ ] Dev Review
- [ ] Test cases added (Unit/ Integration / E2E)
- [ ] Manually tested the changes


---

## 👀 Notes for Reviewers

<!-- Anything reviewers should keep in mind while reviewing -->

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Focuses on more robust TTL/storage-policy testing and reproducibility across clusters.
> 
> - Adds fixtures to reset TTL and storage policy for metrics, traces, and logs (`remove_metrics_ttl_and_storage_settings`, `remove_traces_ttl_and_storage_settings`, `remove_logs_ttl_settings`) to ensure test isolation
> - Expands ClickHouse test container with tiered storage (`storage_configuration` disks/policies) to support cold storage scenarios
> - Makes DDLs cluster-safe by using `ON CLUSTER` for table renames/creates/drops; adds explicit `column_names` for logs inserts to prevent schema drift
> - Cleans up logs/metrics fixtures (optional string values, property accessors, removal of hardcoded fields) and broadens table truncation in teardowns
> - Improves SigNoz readiness check to return only on HTTP 200
> - Adds Makefile targets for selective pytest setup/teardown and a cache cleanup task (`py-test-setup`, `py-test-teardown`, `py-clean`)
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1c5f93aae517a03c69c81595b0b549ed1f043034. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

d.title: fix: show precision for dashboard panels
d.body: ## 📄 Summary The getYAxisFormattedValue function was calling Grafana's getValueFormat function with undefined for the decimal places parameter. This caused the Grafana formatter to truncate precision, resulting in values like 295.4299833508185 being displayed as 295.43. Additionally, the further logic of finding 2 non-zero places in the decimal was there but due to initial precision loss, this logic doesn't help. Fix: ------ - Added decimal precision selector with options - 0,1,2,3,4 and full, with a default of 2 - In a longer string with lots of leading zeros, we preserve it and look for the first (precision value) significant non-zeros. - Preserves the actual value. - Applicable for all panels (only dashboards) except Histogram and List panel Before: ----------- After: ---------- Decimal Precision Selector ------------------ https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0f10c6ad-02af-40ee-81b1-cdb744cf0305 --- ## ✅ Changes - [ ] Feature: Brief description - [ ] Bug fix: Brief description --- ## 🏷️ Required: Add Relevant Labels > ⚠️ **Manually add appropriate labels in the PR sidebar** Please select one or more labels (as applicable): ex: - `frontend` - `backend` - `devops` - `bug` - `enhancement` - `ui` - `test` --- ## 👥 Reviewers > Tag the relevant teams for review: - frontend / backend / devops --- ## 🧪 How to Test 1. ... 2. ... 3. ... --- ## 🔍 Related Issues - [Do not round up the value](https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/8770) --- ## 📸 Screenshots / Screen Recording (if applicable / mandatory for UI related changes) --- ## 📋 Checklist - [ ] Dev Review - [ ] Test cases added (Unit/ Integration / E2E) - [ ] Manually tested the changes --- ## 👀 Notes for Reviewers ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Enhances Y-axis value formatting to preserve up to 5 decimal places and handle various precision scenarios across different unit types. > > - Adds `formatDecimalWithLeadingZeros()` to preserve leading zeros and significant decimal digits > - Modifies `getYAxisFormattedValue()` to: > - Preserve up to 5 decimal places for non-'none' formats > - Handle special values like `Infinity`, `NaN` > - Maintain precision for values with leading zeros > - Adds Sentry error tracking for formatting failures > - Updates test cases to reflect new precision handling > - Improves value display in `TablePanelWrapper` and `ValuePanelWrapper` > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for b6a1188423dc56d305903de668bd1d2ae2a0fbdb. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/SigNoz/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: refactor auth package
d.body: Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/platform-pod/issues/458 ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Refactors authentication package by introducing `authtypes.JWT` for JWT handling, updating context management, and modifying middleware and server setup accordingly. > > - **JWT Refactor**: > - Introduces `authtypes.JWT` for JWT handling, replacing old JWT logic. > - Updates `Login`, `Register`, and other auth functions to use `authtypes.JWT`. > - Removes `auth0/go-jwt-middleware` and `github.com/golang-jwt/jwt` dependencies. > - **Context Management**: > - Adds `ContextFromRequest` in `authtypes.JWT` for extracting JWT from request headers. > - Introduces `authtypes.UUID` for managing UUIDs in context. > - **Middleware and Server**: > - Updates `middleware/auth.go` to use new JWT handling. > - Modifies `server.go` to integrate new JWT and UUID context management. > - **Tests**: > - Updates integration tests to use new JWT handling. > - Adds tests for `authtypes.JWT` in `jwt_test.go`. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 28f4dfa777c7dafaec4d332eb91c78d7f5cdd142. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: use numerical comparison instead of lexicographical for string-encoded numbers
d.body: Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/9110 Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/8963 ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Introduces `DataTypeCollisionHandledFieldName` to handle mixed data types in queries, updating condition builders and adding tests. > > - **Behavior**: > - Introduces `DataTypeCollisionHandledFieldName` in `pkg/querybuilder/fallback_expr.go` to handle mixed data types in queries. > - Updates `CollisionHandledFinalExpr` in `fallback_expr.go` to use the new function. > - Integrates `DataTypeCollisionHandledFieldName` into condition builders in `condition_builder.go` files for `telemetrylogs`, `telemetrymetadata`, and `telemetrytraces`. > - **Tests**: > - Adds `TestDataTypeCollisionHandledFieldName` in `fallback_expr_test.go` to test the new function. > - Updates `filter_expr_logs_test.go` to include scenarios for data type collisions. > - Adds integration tests in `a_logs.py` to verify behavior with mixed data types. > - **Misc**: > - Adds `IsComparisonOperator` method to `FilterOperator` in `builder_elements.go` to support the new function. > - Removes old `DataTypeCollisionHandledFieldName` from `field.go`. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 29dd9db89726762b1639fd45e6f40adde2051d7b. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/SigNoz/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: Fix: Multitenancy support for ORG
d.body: Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/platform-pod/issues/459 Also relates to https://github.com/SigNoz/platform-pod/issues/453 * removes user flags from backend code and db and also the frontend code is removed for that. * ingestion keys should be as it is since we will remove it soon. * Appdex settings has org id now. ( uses org id from context to populate the db) * The migration has to create a new table and drop the old one to change the primary key * Timestamp datatype is changed for org, users and invites. Invites UI is updated to fix it to render properly. others are not required. --- Note: This PR doesn't cover anything related to creating multiple ORG. that will be tackled in the end. Also org id is not enforced on groups as right now groups are initalized during startup we will have to solve for it differently ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Enhances multitenancy support by removing user flags, updating timestamp data types, and refactoring user-related code to include organization IDs. > > - **Behavior**: > - Removes user flags from backend and frontend. > - Updates `AppDao` to handle organization IDs for Apdex settings. > - Changes timestamp data types for `org`, `users`, and `invites`. > - **Database**: > - Drops `user_flags` table. > - Adds `org_id` to `groups` table. > - Modifies `apdex_settings` to include `org_id`. > - Migrates `created_at` to timestamp and `is_anonymous` to boolean. > - **Code Refactoring**: > - Replaces `basemodel.User` with `types.User` in multiple files. > - Updates `GetUserFromRequestContext` to return `types.GettableUser`. > - Refactors `auth.go`, `dao/interface.go`, and `dao/sqlite/auth.go` to use new user model. > - **Frontend**: > - Removes `setFlags.ts` and related components. > - Updates `Members/index.tsx` to handle new timestamp format. > - **Testing**: > - Updates integration tests to align with new user and org models. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 52aac60642f007b53a0b97235b6a5f37b4bcc7cc. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: use common timeout middleware
d.body: Part of https://github.com/SigNoz/platform-pod/issues/406 * uses the timeout middleware from middleware pkg. * remove the old duplicate middlewares ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Replaces custom timeout middleware with a common one, updates configurations, and adjusts tests accordingly. > > - **Middleware Update**: > - Replaces custom `setTimeoutMiddleware` with `middleware.NewTimeout` in `server.go` in `ee/query-service/app` and `pkg/query-service/app`. > - Removes `setTimeoutMiddleware` and related functions from `server.go` in `ee/query-service/app` and `pkg/query-service/app`. > - **Configuration**: > - Adds `Config` struct in `pkg/apiserver/config.go` for timeout settings. > - Updates `example.yaml` with `apiserver.timeout` settings. > - Deprecates `CONTEXT_TIMEOUT` and `CONTEXT_TIMEOUT_MAX_ALLOWED` in `pkg/signoz/config.go`. > - **Testing**: > - Adds `config_test.go` in `pkg/apiserver` to test environment variable configuration. > - Updates `timeout_test.go` in `pkg/http/middleware` to test new timeout middleware behavior. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 6f2450adbd3088cdba6ed7c1c3a170dd6720fd1c. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: use proper indexes for full text search
d.body:
Fixes #4259 

changes
* body searches use lower(body) now.
* ~~attributes search with operator  `contains` will also use `lower(attribute)` now but there is no change for them.~~
* json search add's new filters i.e where clauses.

d.title: fix: update live tail api
d.body: Fixes https://github.com/SigNoz/engineering-pod/issues/2809 eg:- ``` /api/v3/logs/livetail?start=1754910151000&filter=service.name=newlinetab1 ``` two query params start = start timestamp fitler = logs filter ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Adds new live tailing API for logs with `RequestTypeRawStream`, updating query building and validation logic, and removing old implementations. > > - **Behavior**: > - Adds `QueryRawStream` method in `api.go` for live tailing logs with `start` and `filter` query params. > - Introduces `RequestTypeRawStream` in `request_type.go` for live streaming logs. > - Removes old live tailing methods `LiveTailLogsV3` and `LiveTailLogsV4` from `clickhouseReader/reader.go`. > - **Interfaces**: > - Adds `QueryRawStream` to `Querier` interface in `interfaces.go`. > - Removes `LiveTailLogsV3` and `LiveTailLogsV4` from `Reader` interface in `interfaces.go`. > - **Query Building**: > - Updates `Build` method in `statement_builder.go` to handle `RequestTypeRawStream`. > - Adjusts time filter logic in `addTimeFilter` in `resourcefilter/statement_builder.go` and `telemetrylogs/statement_builder.go`. > - **Validation**: > - Updates `Validate` method in `validation.go` to support `RequestTypeRawStream` without end time. > - **Misc**: > - Updates tests in `stmt_builder_test.go` to include `RequestTypeRawStream` scenarios. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 158b516cfd3e057b539d4c74d942ede0a935274d. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/SigNoz/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: new implementation for finding missing timerange
d.body: Part of #7183 This just makes sure that we get the correct timeranges to query. please start with the last three tests to get a better idea and then move to the other tests where are the same ones as previous with slight modifications. cases ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1cee5b54-96ec-41fe-8c34-6fd7b55b2d86) ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Introduces `FindMissingTimeRangesV2` for improved missing time range detection in query cache, with extensive tests for various scenarios. > > - **Behavior**: > - Adds `FindMissingTimeRangesV2` to `query_range_cache.go` for improved handling of missing time ranges, addressing rounding issues in the original `FindMissingTimeRanges`. > - Handles cases where start or end times are not aligned with aggregation windows, merging overlapping or adjacent missing ranges. > - **Tests**: > - Extensive test cases added in `query_range_cache_test.go` for `FindMissingTimeRangesV2`, covering scenarios like subset, superset, overlaps, disjoint, and no cached data. > - Tests ensure correct identification of missing intervals and proper merging of ranges. > - **Interfaces**: > - Updates `QueryCache` interface in `interface.go` to include `FindMissingTimeRangesV2`. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 190f79c1b79177bd42be7866eb1f720bfdde54b4. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: added backticks for tags containing dots while generating query …
d.body: …for v3 and v4 | 6069 ### Summary Click house query generated with tags that contains dot in their key name was throwing error, encapsulated that specific keys with backticks. #### Related Issues / PR's https://github.com/SigNoz/signoz/issues/6069 #### Screenshots NA #### Affected Areas and Manually Tested Areas Clickhouse queries with tags that have dot in them wont work ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Fix ClickHouse query errors by adding backticks to tags with dots in query building and formatting functions. > > - **Behavior**: > - Fix ClickHouse query errors by adding backticks to tags with dots in `query_builder.go`, `clauses.go`, and `sub_query.go`. > - Update `AddBackTickToFormatTag` and `AddBackTickToFormatTags` in `format.go` to handle tags with dots. > - **Functions**: > - Modify `groupingSets`, `groupBy`, `groupSelect`, and `orderBy` in `query_builder.go` to use backticks for tags. > - Update `GroupingSetsByAttributeKeyTags`, `GroupByAttributeKeyTags`, and `OrderByAttributeKeyTags` in `clauses.go` to add backticks. > - Adjust `PrepareTimeseriesFilterQuery` and `PrepareTimeseriesFilterQueryV3` in `sub_query.go` to format tags with backticks. > - **Tests**: > - Add test cases in `query_builder_test.go`, `table_test.go`, and `timeseries_test.go` for cumulative and delta metrics to verify queries with tags containing dots. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for ebf50fcbe2b43f93802db17218d614b3d233c498. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: chore: trace funnels bugfixes/improvements
d.body: ## 📄 Summary --- ## ✅ Changes - [x] Bug fix: Add missing refetch query for funnel steps overview on refresh action - [x] Chore: temporarily hide latency pointer as it --- ## 🏷️ Required: Add Relevant Labels > ⚠️ **Manually add appropriate labels in the PR sidebar** Please select one or more labels (as applicable): ex: - `frontend` - `backend` - `devops` - `bug` - `enhancement` - `ui` - `test` --- ## 👥 Reviewers > Tag the relevant teams for review: - frontend / backend / devops --- ## 🧪 How to Test 1. ... 2. ... 3. ... --- ## 🔍 Related Issues Closes # --- ## 📸 Screenshots / Screen Recording (if applicable / mandatory for UI related changes) --- ## 📋 Checklist - [x] Dev Review - [ ] Test cases added (Unit/ Integration / E2E) - [x] Manually tested the changes --- ## 👀 Notes for Reviewers ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Improves funnel tracing by adding refetch for funnel steps and hiding latency pointer, with UI and hook enhancements for better state management and user feedback. > > - **Behavior**: > - Adds refetch query for funnel steps overview on refresh in `useFunnelConfiguration.tsx`. > - Temporarily hides latency pointer in `FunnelStep.tsx` and `FunnelStep.styles.scss` due to unresolved issues. > - **UI Components**: > - Updates `AddSpanToFunnelModal.tsx` to handle save and discard actions with new state management. > - Modifies `FunnelConfiguration.tsx` to integrate new funnel step handling logic. > - Adjusts styles in `AddSpanToFunnelModal.styles.scss` and `FunnelConfiguration.styles.scss` for better UI consistency. > - **Hooks**: > - Enhances `useFunnelConfiguration.tsx` to support manual and auto-save modes with notifications. > - Refines `useLocalStorage.ts` to stabilize default values and prevent unnecessary re-renders. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for c6a24d175b3025c50cafd0a5a91b548e4b4cdfaa. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/SigNoz/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.

d.title: fix: added fix for extractquerypararms when value is string in multivalue operators
d.body: ## 📄 Summary --- ## ✅ Changes - Added fix for extractQueryPararms when value is string in multivalue operators. ---- > [!IMPORTANT] > Fix handling of string values in multi-value operators in `extractQueryPairs` and add tests for query pair extraction and expression conversion. > > - **Behavior**: > - Fix `extractQueryPairs` to handle string values in multi-value operators in `queryContextUtils.ts`. > - Preserve existing formatting if existing query values match current filter values in `convertFiltersToExpressionWithExistingQuery` in `utils.ts`. > - **Tests**: > - Add tests for `convertFiltersToExpressionWithExistingQuery` in `utils.test.ts`. > - Add tests for `extractQueryPairs` in `queryContextUtils.test.ts`. > - **Misc**: > - Add `isEqual` and `sortBy` from `lodash-es` in `utils.ts` for array comparison. > > This description was created by [](https://www.ellipsis.dev?ref=SigNoz%2Fsignoz&utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral) for 603d6d6fce804ea41e0e7180c5080d70a5c9a7a5. You can [customize](https://app.ellipsis.dev/SigNoz/settings/summaries) this summary. It will automatically update as commits are pushed.
